original: The Kriyakramadyotika by Aghoraśivācārya who lived in South India in the 12th century, is the primary ritual manual which guides ritual procedure in most of the major śaiva temples of South India. This is a major commentary on it by Kacchepeśvara who lived in Kāñcī. At the beginning he refers to Aghoraśiva as his teacher telling us that he wrote it impelled by his grace.
